author: M.
D.
Cozma
title: Neutron-proton elliptic flow difference as a probe for the high density dependence of the symmetry energy
keywords: Symmetry energy, Equation of state of nuclear matter, Quantum molecular dynamics, Heavy-ion collisions, Elliptic flow
abstract: We employ an isospin dependent version of the QMD transport model to study the influence of the isospin dependent part of the nuclear matter equation of state and in-medium nucleonânucleon cross-sections on the dynamics of heavy-ion collisions at intermediate energies. We find that the extraction of useful information on the isospin-dependent part of the equation of state of nuclear matter from proton or neutron elliptic flows is obstructed by their sensitivity to model parameters and in-medium values of nucleonânucleon cross-sections. Opposite to that, neutronâproton elliptic flow difference shows little dependence on those variables while its dependence on the isospin asymmetric EoS is enhanced, making it more suitable for a model independent constraining of the high-density behaviour of asy-EoS. Comparison with existing experimental FOPI-LAND neutronâhydrogen data can be used to set an upper limit to the softness of asy-EoS. Successful constraining of the asy-EoS via neutronâproton elliptic flow difference will require experimental data of higher accuracy than presently available.
